name: mislocate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to wrongly say or think that something is in a particular place or position: We mislocated the town of Millau: it is not, as stated, in the Pyrenees. Archaeologists have located a number of sites, including one that was previously documented but mislocated. Related words
locate
mislocation
More examplesFewer examplesHe researches the criteria by which people locate or mislocate sensations as being in certain parts of their bodies.We mislocated the sea battle off the coast of Egypt: it took place off the west coast of Greece.
